description: Largest prime substring of n, or 0 if no such substring exists.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: a[n_] := (id = IntegerDigits[n]; lg = Length[id]; sel = Select[ FromDigits /@ Flatten[ Table[ id[[i ;; j]], {i, 1, lg}, {j, i, lg}], 1], PrimeQ]; If[ sel === {}, 0, Last[ Sort[ sel] ] ]); Table[ a[n], {n, 0, 99}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 23 2012 *)lps[m_]:=Max[Select[Flatten[Table[FromDigits/@Partition[ IntegerDigits[ m],n,1],{n,IntegerLength[m]}]],PrimeQ]]; Array[lps,100,0]/. -\[Infinity]->0 (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 26 2014 *)
prog: (Haskell)import Data.List (isInfixOf)a047814 n = if null ips then 0 else head ips   where ips = [p | p <- reverse $ takeWhile (<= n) a000040_list,                    show p `isInfixOf` show n]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 08 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
